1.content:
This is not the way you wanted to start your day! Blearily you try to work out what is going on. Have you just woken up?
Slowly you open an eye, but cannot make anything out, your vision is completely blurred. Right now your head aches more when you open your eyes so you leave that for later and shut your eye for now.
That doesn't leave much to go with:
Touch. You seem to be laying on sand, cool sand it seems. Are you on a beach? Your muscles ache, but after a little effort you move your hand around and feel the sand up close. It's not smooth, there are a lot of pebbles in it. Not a high quality beach then.
Sound. Well, you mostly hear the thrumming of your heart, but there are some odd noises faintly in the background. Not things you can place, but they seem insect like in nature. Maybe you're near a forrest?
Smell. It's actually rather fragrent here, but dry. There certainly seems to be vegetation nearby, and probably flowers, rather sweet smelling from the aroma.
Memory. This is tricky. Are you waking up from a nap and just have terrible recollection of the day before or... wait, some details are coming back. The insitute, some form of accident, klaxons going off, alarms sounding. Yes, there was something wrong with the accelerator in the basement. You were three stories up from that though, what could have affected you?
OK, that hasn't helped much, maybe you'd better wait a little while and try again? After all it's fairly comfortable here you could.... just.....

With a jerk you shake awake, your mouth dry and your eyes seem stuck shut. How long were you asleep? Now what?

11.content:
It's not easy. It feels like glue is sticking your eyelids together, but with a little effort you clear your eyes and take a look around you.
Well, it's night time at least, though brighter than you'd expect. Maybe it's a full moon?
Glancing ahead you can see a rough terrain, stony hillocks breaking into sand dunes. Are you on the edge of a desert? Maybe Scrubland of some sort. The bushes about are unfamiliar.
As you peer about you see something bright in the sky behind you. Turning, feeling your aching muscles complain, you look over your shoulder and...
There isn't a full moon... there are TWO full moons next to each other. They appear fairly similar, each a little smaller than the one you've known all your life, but look like asteroids, not circular at all.
Now you are looking you see that the stars are wrong too, nothing familiar. Wait, why can you see stars at all? Usually a combination of bright moon and background light makes your eyes adjust till you can't make out the faint stars.
Well, the terrain is dark, and you can't see any stars right alongside the moon... er, moons, but elsewhere in the sky... You guess there is just no light pollution from cities nearby to blank them out.
Just then some noise catches your attention. It sounded like a cut off scream from behind a hillock nearby.

"Sure." Yandi says and starts off, then stops and turns back. "Hey, you wanna check out the spaceport first? They're probably due to launch soon. There is usually one in the early afternoon. It's pretty fun to watch."
This reminds you of Yandi's earlier speech... what little of it you remember before you fell asleep. You vaguely remember something about 'breeding' for machines, or at least you think that was what she was talking about. Do they have nano technology here? Maybe viewing the spaceport would be a good place to find out.
"Why not, I've only seen a few space launches before, and I'm sure ours are different from yours."
Yandi seems to frown at that comment, but shrugs it off, nods, then she leads you off to the hill. Maybe you shouldn't comment too much on your world's technology. Who knows what she'd make of that, though she seems to be quite blase about everything so far, you never quite know what phobias, taboos or other cultural differences can affect things like this.
The three of you head up the hill and you notice a bit more vegetation around, mostly yellow green bushes. However, all this disappears from your attention as you come to the top of the hill and look down on the town of Lorrem.
The sight is breathtaking, a sweeping vista of brown, green and blue buildings in a smooth bulbous design. The town has higher buildings nearer the center, as Human buildings do, but here they are also wider, some look like enourmous, smooth domes, while others like elongated, dome topped cylinders, but all seem to be limited to being about three times their width in height. Maybe it's some sort of limit to their building's design?
Suddenly you see a flash to the left side of the city (from what Yandi said about direction earlier you think that is the east side) and you notice a flickering light there, slowly floating upwards, seemingly unsupported. As you squint you see the light is a sort of flame on the back of an odd shaped mass. Is that a space ship? The flame isn't under it though, how can that support it? It looks more like a candle, curling upwards, than an exhaust. That can't...
Suddenly the flame squirts backwards in a tight jet that turns from the golden yellow it was to a deep transparent blue. In response the craft shoots in the opposite direction, not up as it was floating, but away from you, building speed rapidly.
"Wow!" you say, watching as it pulls up, looking more like a wingless aircraft as it climbs on the pillar of blue fire, shooting into the distance. There is little noise from it, more like a quiet jet engine than anything else and you have to admit you are impressed as you see it shrink to a dot, then disappear from view.
"Cool huh?" Yandi says "Wait till you see a heavy transport go up, those suckers are huge!"
"That wasn't a transport?" you say, turning to her.
"Heck no, just a personnel ship, probably some rich kid's toy or a corporate exec's craft. Watch the launch area to see if anything else is due to launch."

Before you can think much further on the subject you notice a huge shape there start to move. You thought that was a building at first! It must be over a hundred foot in length, looking a little mishapen, but overall like a slightly flattened tear drop on it's side. As you watch you see it rise up smoothly off the ground without any dust blown up around it. What kind of propulsion could lift such a craft without kicking up dust? There are even people nearby down there (if those tiny moving dots are people) and they don't seem to feel any wind from the ship.
Then you see the round end of the craft start to flicker, just like the first ship, and soon a flame is licking from the rear. This time though it slowly twists around so the point of the craft is almost straight at you. Once it has floated up to what you estimate as about a thousand feet you see a flash behind it as the engine kicks in and it surges towards you. This one accelerates a little slower than the first one, looking more the way the shuttle does on lift off... although sideways.
You shake your head in amazement. How do they get something that size to fly like that seemingly so effortlessly? Then you do a double take. As it gets closer you can see details and it is starting to look decidedly odd, almost... organic! It's soon picked up quite a speed and as it swoops high over your head you can make out fish like fins on the side, ribbing, even what looks like many small crab-like legs folded up on the bottom.
"Oh my god it's alive!" you whisper as it shoots off into the distance, getting faster and further away.
"Huh?" Yandi says, looking perplexed. "Of course it is, it's flying isn't it? Wouldn't want a dead ship overhead that's for sure!"

You know a fair bit about engineering after all, even though your main study has been particle physics. explanations the other way are a little simplified as the woman (she says her name is Yandi Emerett) seems to be fairly in the dark about any of the details of her technology.
Basically it seems to boil down to this. As far back as anyone can remember the Life Guilds have worked living creatures into tools. They design alterations to living creatures till they can do any task, even that of spaceship! How that is possible you can't even imagine! For the last few centuries however four of the great guilds have been acting as one under the name of the 'Trade Commission' and have virtually cornered the market on important tools.
This world is the home world, called 'Lan', but there are over a dozen other worlds around nearby stars that have been lightly colonized in the last century by the Trade Commission. It seems they have a stranglehold on the trade routes as they invented the means of star travel. Most of the creatures they sell are neuters, unable to breed, forcing people to buy new tools from the Commission when their current ones grow old and die. It seems however that this was not always the case, and there are still the remnants of a few of the old Life Guilds around who sell simpler, breeding tools, though they are gradually being pushed out of the market.
Right now there is still a separate government here on Lan, though the Commission rules the colonies in all but name. There is talk, as Yandi tells it, that it is trying to take control here too and word has spread of a rebellion who wishes to fight against them.

11222212.title: Alone again.

choices: Your tackle dislodges the girl from the wolf's maw.
You are in tangle with the girl still being eaten!
1122222.content:
You suddenly feel adrenaline flood your body. They can't do this!
With a surge of energy you didn't think you had you burst from your cover and charge at the wolf, slapping Mervin away as you pass.
"Hey. Oof!" the thing says as it tumbles to the ground in a mass of writhing tentacles. You barely notice as you drive into the rather surprised looking wolf.
"Let go of her!" you shout as your shoulder rams into his chest.
1122222.title: Charge!

choices: He is angry! You'll replace the catwoman!
Something stops him.
11222221.content:
With a loud 'PLOP!' the girl's upper body jerks free of the wolf and lands in a heap on the ground. You tumble to the floor with the wolf who looks much larger now your right on top of him!
"Why d'ja go'n do dat den?" the wolf says with a sad expression. Effortlessly he grasps your shoulders and heaves you off him.
11222221.title: Release!

choices: A judder stops your descent.
There is no stopping and you end in his belly.
112222211.content:
"Wha...?" you gasp and see red, literally, as the wolf's jaws gape before you. It seems he's decided to finish you off instead of the catwoman!
Staggering you feel the sweltering heat inside him as his mouth suck on your head, then shoulders, soaking your lab coat. Oh god, is this really happening?
A heavy rolling gulp echos around you and moist heaving muscles roll in, sucking you down. Struggle all you can it does no good and you gasp as those canine lips press into your chest and then over it. You're actually being eaten alive! Shuddering you feel the thing pawing your rear, pushing you into him. God that feels... good? No, this isn't.... Oh god!
You can't help the heat spreading through your body, and it has nothing to do with the humid insides of the wolf! How can you be feeling horny as you are being swallowed?
112222211.title: Your turn!

choices: What usually happens to meal once it's eaten?
Something interupts Arnold outside.
1122222112.content:
Gurgling gulps and odd sucking sounds pound around you as your body is massaged, pulled and oozed down into the depth's of the wolf's body. With a pop you feel your head emerge into a tiny chamber, filling it already. The stomach! Soon your shoulders are stretching it and you are finding it hard to breath.
Arnold finishes off your rear then plays with your legs as he sucks them up, finally nibbling lightly on your toes before gulping them down to leave you curled fetally in his belly, his stomach skin tight all around you.
"Der, that serves you right! You shouldn't have 'urt me!" he says, patting you through his belly.
1122222112.title: End of descent.

11222221121.content:
"OK boss," comes from outside the stomach as Arnold stands up, "Now what?"
"Ungh! Help me up you oaf!" comes the response from Mervin, somewhat muffled with Arnold's belly between you and him.
You can feel yourself tossed about inside Arnold and are getting faint from lack of air. For the next minute or so you manage to make a pocket of air by tucking your head against your arms, but that soon runs out.
Before you finally black out you can just begin to feel a tingling on your legs. You lose consciousness before company arrives in the form of the struggling catwoman. Soon the two of you are stuffed tight in the wolf's belly slowly digesting away. It takes a long time for his stomach to deal with you, but it manages.
This is not a particularly good end for a harvard graduate!
"BURRP!"
11222221121.title: Finality

choices: Panic!
Try and talk with... it.
Pay a little more attention before reacting.
Wait for it to do something.
14.content:
You are just trying to make your mind up if you can risk opening your eyes when something hard lands on your left shoulder. For a moment you freeze, wondering whether it is an animal touching you or a person's hand.
Finally you manage to turn your head and ease your eyes open. What you see shocks you.
Above you is a... creature. It looks like a squid standing upright on short tentacles but with a face about a third of the way up it's body. The face is sort of recognizable. There are two eyes, though they seem to have two pupils one above the other, there is a mouth, but lipless, and there is only a downward facing slit, or maybe flap, for a nose.
Glancing down you see one of it's tentacles is resting on your shoulder. It seems to be just staring at you.
14.title: Finding a native.

choices: The creature interupts your musings.
You try to communicate with it.
143.content:
You stare. It's hard to anything else. You are painfully aware that there is NOTHING like this on Earth, so where the heck are you? Just then you see behind the... thing to the sky, the black sky. You had been so focussed on the creature you hadn't even noticed that it was night-time.
The sky is bright with stars and you can even make out the Milky Way. There can't be much artificial lighting nearby. That is when you pay attention to the stars themselves.
They aren't ones you recognise... any of them! No constellations seem familiar at all!
143.title: Details.

choices: Lie to it. Of course you have a tag!
Why would that matter? What's a tag?
1431.content:
It's overwhelming to have the reality of your situation brought home so clearly. You begin to shake as you try to wrap your brain around the concept.
"Get up, you aren't injured. Where is your tag?"
For a moment you don't react, then gape. This... thing just spoke clear English... actually rather proper British accented English.
"I'm sorry, what?" you manage to respond.
It huffs, seemingly annoyed, and suddenly it is searching you for something, it's tentacles everywhere over your clothes, going into pockets. For a moment you panic as the fear that it is going to rape you, but it seems that is not on the agenda. It stops after only a few seconds.
"You don't have a tag do you?" It says, smiling.
1431.title: Communication.

choices: Fight free of it. It won't take you without a fight!
It has you to tightly. You can't escape.
14312.content:
"W... what are you talking about? What kind of tag?" you stutter.
The squid-thing laughs evily and turns to shout behind it.
"Hey, Arnold! We got a runner!" and as it says this four tentacles shoot down to wrap you up.
14312.title: Not a good thing!

choices: They find other runners.
They head back to the 'troop' with only you.
143122.content:
You struggle hard, but it's no good it has you far too tightly. The creature is far stronger than it looked and proceeds to heft you bodily off the floor, tipping itself back on it's other tentacles to balance itself.
"Arnold! Come on, I am not hauling this thing back to camp myself!" the squid thing yells.
Unable to move you gasp, glancing around at the terrain nearby. It looks more scrub than desert. Maybe this is the edge of a desert? You can see shrubs and bushes nearby and maybe a river a little ways off. Why can you make out so much detail at night? It's much brighter than you expected.
Then the squid thing turns around, and you turn with it. Glaring down from the sky you see two moons, very bright, each a little smaller than Earth's moon and both irregular. As you stare at them you could swear you can see them slowly moving across the sky!
"Arnold, hurry it up!"
Ahead of you you see something lumber out from behind a dead tree. It's hairy, man shaped and over seven foot tall as far as you can tell. It also has a wolf's head!
"OK, OK, I'z a comin'. No need to gets in a tizzy Mervin!" it says as it lumbers up.
'Mervin' the squid thing huffs in response then practically throws you at Arnold who catches you expertly.
"We'd better get going Arnold. Lets see if we can find any other runners before the troop heads out."
Mervin turns and heads off, Arnold shaking his head and following in his slow gait.
143122.title: Too tight!

choices: Arnold throws you 'into' one of the animals! Soon more aliens join you inside.
Arnold put you in one of the odd tee pees, which is full of sad looking aliens.
1431222.content:
The wolf thing is very strong, but surprisingly gentle as it throws your head and shoulders over his shoulder, gripping your waist with both hands, pinning your arms by your side very effectively. As he strides along you bounce against him only able to see where you've been. Soon you are moving across a path in the scrub as the two... aliens head further on.
"Keep your eyes open Arnold, you know you can see better in the dark than me. If there are any runners around I don't want to miss them!"
"Yez boss" he mutters.
Arnold seems rather tired, and a little sad. Honestly he sounds like he doesn't really like Mervin, but just has to do what he says. You can't believe he is related to the squid so it's probably just 'boss' part of this. He certainly is way stronger than you and it doesn't take much wriggling to prove to you that you aren't going to get out of his grip easily.
"Ungh! Could you ease up on your gait Arnold?" you gasp as he bounces along, "This is rather a rough ride."
"Huh? Oh, sorry." and he walks a bit easier, you not jarring against his shoulder so much.
"Um thank you." you mutter, not sure how to react to the big guy. He seems nice but is still kidnapping you. You think you're still partly in shock.
After a few more minutes Mervin sighs up ahead.
"Guess we aren't picking up anyone else." he mutters and Arnold turns a bit, allowing you to glance over your shoulder and see where you're heading; an area with several odd, tee pee like structures and two gigantic animals curled on the ground, like huge furry mounds over thirty foot long and fifteen foot high!
1431222.title: They head back to the 'troop' with you.

choices: It's totally alien, as are the other four creatures that come in.
It looks like a female humanoid cat, and four more similar 'people' come in.
14312221.content:
"Arnold, put her in Charley then get the rest ready for shipping out. I want to be in Therem tomorrow."
'In Charley'? What is he talking about?
"C'mon Charley, wakey wakey." Arnold says softly apparently prodding something ahead of him. Soon animal snorts punctuate the night, loud snorts. "There ya go. Open up, chop chop, you've got guests."
Before you can work out what the hell he is talking about he lifts you from his shoulder and heaves you forward. The world gets darker and as you tip over, flying through the air, you see a very wide set of dull, rounded teeth, then red ribbed skin sliding by a few inches above you! With a splat you land on something yielding, soft and... MOVING! Looking down you can see it's a TONGUE! A two foot wide tongue!
Suddenly the MOUTH Arnold threw you into closes tightly on you, sucking in your feet through soft rubbery lips and gulping. Huge squeezing presses down on you for a moment while you struggle and try to scream, but flesh is pressed too tight everywhere for you to do anything. Then you pop out into a huge chamber, sliding down to a flat floor. As you stagger to your feet, blinking the spit out of your eyes, you see you are in a living cavern about twenty foot long, ten foot wide and ten foot high! The arched ceiling glows a dull yellow, the flat floor rippling as your feet slightly sink into the fleshy ground!
"What... the... hell!" you gasp, starting to shake from nerves, fear or just the whole experience so far.
*Plop! Thump!*
You gasp as another body slides in the opening you came in by.
14312221.title: Arnold throws you 'into' one of the animals.

choices: You try to get some background while Charley heads to town.
While Charley heads to town something odd happens to the other guests.
143122212.content:
"Ungh! Damn Arnold, why doesn't he ever just ASK!" the... feline?.. says standing up a bit wobbly.
She shakes her furred head and comes over to you. In the dim light she really does look like a six foot tall female, humanoid cat; cat-like ears, whiskers, slitted eyes and even the hands look like paws with long human like fingers (still with pads and claws though).
"Yandi." she says and holds her hand... paw out to you.
You blink for a few seconds, but obviously your form isn't as obviously weird to her as hers is to you. Slowly you raise your hand and she grips it, shaking it powerfully. She's got one hell of a grip!
"Um, Lucy." you mutter. Then wonder what to say. This girl obviously knows what's going on around here and seems it's old hat to her, if annoying perhaps. Should you admit to your ignorance? As you're trying to decide another thump heralds a visitor arriving, this time it's a four foot tall rabbit girl, followed almost immediately by a five foot fox girl. The pair stagger to their feet shake themselves down and the fox waves to Yandi, then to you.
"Hey new girl. I'm Donna and this Kaero. She doesn't talk much." The rabbit girl frowns at Donna but doesn't refute what the vixen said.
"Um," you say, finally realizing you can't put this off, you've got to find out what's going on around here, "I'm not really sure what's happening. I've only just arrived, Mervin said something about a 'tag' but I really don't understand this. Where am I?"
All three girls look suddenly perplexed.
"You're an offworlder?" Yandi says, staring at you "I didn't know any worlds didn't use the tag system. Commission or guild I thought they all did. Well, this is the only independent guild world I know of. What world are you from?"
"Um, Earth. And we haven't had any contact with any of these worlds yet, certainly I don't recognize any of the races I've seen so far." Should she mention Earth hasn't met ANY aliens yet? Before she can think on that two more 'guests' plop into the chamber, a three foot tall, very hairy dog girl (maybe old English sheep dog? Why are all these creatures loosely based on Earth animals? Coincidence?), and a seven foot tall dour looking horse girl.
"Well, the gangs all here." Yandi says "Guess the guys are all cooped up in Mikey too. We'll be on our way soon."
143122212.title: Five cell mates arrive.

choices: Yes, though usually we just do as Charley commands, not you Mistress.
No. I've never heard of this phenomena before Mistress.
1431222122.content:
The room shakes just after Yandi's comment and 'Charley' starts walking. You can't hear anything from outside, presumably the... stomach?.. that you're in is soundproof. Just the thought of being in some creatures stomach starts to get to you, but you just tell yourself that the other 'girls' seem calm at this so you should be too. It must be some alien form of transport... prison transport you guess.
You sit down against one of the curving, fleshy walls and try to relax as the room rythmically shakes with Charley's gait.
"Um, how far is it to... um, Therem?" you say, trying to remember what Mervin said earlier.
Yandi jerks oddly, staring at you for a moment, eyes unfocussed. Then she shakes her head.
"Uh, sorry. Miles away I guess. The way these guys plod along I think we have most of the day in here." she walks to a dimple in the side of the creature's stomach wall and puts her lips to it! Pressing the alongside it you see her gulp. "Need any water? No food here, Charley's a cheap model."
You blink, staring at the... nipple?.. or whatever it is. OK, they seem fine with this, and she said it was just water.
"I guess I'm a little thirsty." you say, and cautiously take Yandi's place and lean down. It feels very weird to suck on this teet or whatever it is, but soon cool pure water is pour into your mouth.
"Thanks." you manage.
"So, come from a pretty advanced place do you? Or are you just rich?" Yandi says as she sits beside you, leaning against the wall.
"Huh?" you manage intelligently.
"The covers." she says, pointing at your lab coat and pants. "I've never seen any that thin and flexible. How do they grow them?"
Grow? You look around, realizing that this beast must have been designed to carry people. Maybe all their technology is organic? Including living clothes? Maybe that's why all the people you've seen so far have been naked (barring fur). Only the rich can afford living clothes.
"No, I'm not rich, and this isn't alive, it's cloth spun from living things. A plant creates a ball of fuzz which is stretched into a long strand and then that is woven into this fabric, then cut and sown into these shapes. It's pretty cheap where I come from. Everyone wears things like this, well, this is a work coat, but some sort of covering."
"Um, some of those words I don't even understand." Yandi says, getting that distant look in her eyes again, "But... if you... say so..." She shakes her head. "Oh, I feel kind of weird."
"I'm sorry you aren't feeling well, lay down and relax. Maybe it'll go away." you say.
"Yes Mistress." she says and lays down.
'Mistress'? Glancing around you see some of the others, shaking their heads oddly, glazed look in their eyes too, though Yandi seems almost permanently glazed now. What is going on?
"Yandi? Are you OK?"
"Yeah, I'm... Yes Mistress, I am well." she says.
Now the others are starting to gaze in your direction too, glazed eyes almost constant as well. They seem to be turning into your servants or something. Is this normal?
"Yandi," you say, leaning down to her, "Is the fact that you... are calling me mistress something that always happens in Charley?"
1431222122.title: Odd goings on in Charleys insides.

choices: Try to get them to lighten up a little. This 'Slave' business is too much!
Try to come to terms with having five Slaves as Charley heads for Therem.
14312221222.content:
You blink at her comment as she stares at you.
"Never?"
"No, I do not know of anyone who has suddenly become another beings willing slave before Mistress"
Willing slave? This is weird.
14312221222.title: No. I've never heard of this phenomena before.

choices: Nope, not a clue Lucy. So what do you want us to do?
It's who you are. I can't explain it, just... you naturally are our masters.
143122212221.content:
No, you can't have them being slaved to you somehow. It's just wrong!
"Look, all of you," you say, watching all five girls focus on you, "You aren't my slaves any more."
"No Mistress." comes the chorus of replies.
"No?"
"No Mistress."
You turn to Yandi.
"Why can't you obey me in this Yandi?"
"Because then we would not be your slaves any more Mistress. That is the only certain thing in our lives now. You are Mistress."
You sink back and collapse to the floor. This is ridiculous!
"OK, OK, how about... Yandi? You will now behave and think as you did before you became my slave."
"No Mistress. I was not your slave before Mistress."
"OK..." you say, through gritted teeth "Then from now on you will behave exactly as you did before except being my slave."
Yandi blinks, sighs and sits up smiling.
"Of course Lucy."
"Well, that's something." you mutter, then say the same to the rest of the girls, who similarly return to behaving as they did before... except still being your slaves.
A thought occurs to you. Yandi said earlier that she didn't know of anyone else this had happened to before, but she didn't exactly say she didn't know what was happening.
"Yandi, do you know why you are my slave?"
143122212221.title: Try to get them to lighten up a little.

choices: It's the enclosed space, outside it didn't work.
It's just girls that become slaved, not boys.
1431222122212.content: "It's nothing to do with being inside Charley?" You ask, and Yandi shakes her head. "Naturally... wait, does that mean other people will become my slaves? Why didn't Arnold or Mervin become slaved to me earlier?"
1431222122212.title: It's who you are.

choices: Try to make Charley stop out here to make escape easier.
Decide whether to risk an escape at town or just relax and see what happens.
14312221222121.content:
"I think it's something you give off, and outside it didn't concentrate enough." Yandi said, frowning as she tried to work it out... or remember it or whatever it was she was doing. "I think anyone who was very close to you for a long time, maybe twenty minutes or so, or who was cooped up with you in a closed space like this would become your slaves. I think so at any rate."
You shake your head, this is a lot to wrap your mind around.
"Yandi, you mentioned other worlds earlier, and Commission and Guilds. Could you elaborate? I don't know anything about this."
"Of course Lucy." she says. "Up until recently most worlds were ruled independently but had powerful Life-Molding Guilds that basically ran each planet behind the scenes. About forty years ago four Guilds got together and formed the Guild Commission, later just shortened the title to The Commission. Since then they'd basically taken over their worlds, then spread, seizing or buying out other worlds. There are very few left unconquered now, this is the only one I know of anyway. Other Life-Molder Guilds still exist, but they aren't planet wide concerns, just minor players, being pushed further and further into the edges of commerce by The Commission's new edicts."
Great, you've dropped into an organic version of Star Wars with 'The Commission' replacing 'The Empire'! Well, maybe that's a little too simplistic, but it sure seems this government is pretty much Evil with a capital 'E'.
"Hmm, once we get out of Charley, is there any way to over power Mervin and Arnold?"
Yandi grins.
"Of course, we'll do everything we can to be sure you are free of them."
"Er, and all you lot too right?" you say looking all of the girls.
"That would be difficult. Likely one or two of us would die ensuring your escape. If we could stop out here in the wastelands maybe, but in town? That would be tricky."
"Die? I'm not asking you to give your life for me!"
"OK." Yandi says smiling. These girl's now seem to casually put your orders above their own welfare, no matter how much they sound like they did before.
"I don't suppose we could make Arnold or Mervin climb in here so they'd become slaves?"
"Doubt it, besides it took us at least ten minutes even in here. Mervin is way too impatient to hang around that long even if we could persuade him to come in."
"Hark at me! Talking about how horrible enslaving people is then talking about doing it to two more!"
"Hey, those two really don't deserve to be your slaves anyway!" Yandi said, and snuggled up to you, resting her furry head on your shoulder.
You feel rather uncomfortable with her like this... OK, not uncomfortable, just nervous. What are you going to do?
14312221222121.title: It's the enclosed space inside Charley.

choices: Some Toopa root would sort that out. It grows pretty much everywhere.
Well, you could eat Boduclo food, but I wouldn't want to force that on you!
143122212221211.content:
"Yandi, you said that if we could make Charley stop out here in the scrub we might overpower Marvin and Arnold?"
She nods.
"Yep, I think so, probably have to take out at least Marvin, Arnold pretty much does what Marvin says. Hopefully once Marvin's gone he'll help us, or at least not hinder us."
"Gone?" you say, realizing you know what she means. "What do you mean gone?"
"Hmm? Like I said we'll have to deal with him. Probably be quickest if I can just eat him, unless you'd rather do it yourself?"
Just when you thought you'd got this world understood (in a limited way as yet) something comes up and floors you.
"Eat him? What we start a fire and make a cook out for Marvin?"
Yandi looks quizzically at you.
"Er... no, just swallow him."
Slowly you close your eyes, count to five and try again.
"Swallow him?" you ask quietly "You can swallow someone? Whole? How is that even possible?"
"What d'ya mean?" Yandi asks. "Everyone can do that. I mean how could you eat if you couldn't? You can't live on roots and insects." and she laughs. Oh this world is going to be tough. Better start carefully, make sure you get things sorted out.
"OK, lets start from the top. You eat like everyone else right?" Yandi nods "OK, what do you eat?"
"Boduclos. Me I prefer the smaller, bunny likes, though I've had bigger, some a good deal larger than you."
"You could eat me? Whole?" You say, a quiver in your voice.
"Sure, no trouble. I'm sure you'd taste lovely. I usually go for the Boduclos with less fur, or that silky fuzz. I think Dorlik Guild made that bunny Boduclo with that kind of fur. They're pretty popular around here. I love 'em."
Laying back you rest your head against the wall.
"Boduclo... they're food... what are they exactly?"
"They're like us, but no mind right? Plus they're made to grow real quick. I think they go from eggs to adult in about a week, though I've never grown one myself. They're about the one product that The Commission can't make a neutered version of without pretty much destroying the economy! You'll find breeding pens of them all over."
"And... just suppose, someone were to come around that... oh, I don't know... couldn't physically stretch enough to swallow a... Boduclo whole, what could they eat?"
143122212221211.title: Try to make Charley stop out here to make escape

choices: Wait, you've been inside Charley for ages. Wouldn't he be your slave now?
No, you'll have to try and trick Mervin or Arnold to letting you out.
1431222122212111.content:
"Toopa root?" You ask.
"Yeah, I've heard some sicknesses that can make people unable to swallow, though they're pretty rare. Unless there is serious damage to the throat Toopa root will get things right again. It loosens the jaw, throat and stomach and gets you right for eating again."
"This root will do all that?" you say. Biology isn't your strong suite but that sounds a bit suspicious... "Was the root made by a guild?"
"I... dunno? If so it must have been an awful long time ago. It grows all over the place on this world, and I've heard people talk about it from others too."
"I don't suppose any of you have any Toopa root handy?" they shake their heads.
"How could we?" Donna says "We're slaves. We can't own anything, let alone afford pockets."
OK, with living tech things could get really weird here. Clothes and pockets are a rich person's playthings?
"OK, so I guess that's for when we get out. Um, how could we force Charley to spit us out? Since you're slaves I guess it has restrictions on ways out, right?" Yandi nods
"Yeah, it's entrance only opens for Mervin's or Arnold's voice. They bought and Imprinted the critter."
1431222122212111.title: Some Toopa root would sort that out.

choices: I don't think so, it only works on people.
That might work! Heck, only Charley would hear us in here anyway.
14312221222121111.content:
"I'm inside Charley, and close proximity makes people my slave, right?" Yandi nods "Wouldn't Charley be my slave now? All I'd have to do is order him to let us out?"
Yandi frowns at this, trying to work something out.
14312221222121111.title: Wait, you've been inside Charley for ages.

choices: You don't like the bit about eating Mervin.
You guess it's the only way to keep the girl's unhurt.
143122212221211112.content:
"Yeah, that could work." Yandi says, a broad grin spreading across her face. "And Mervin and Arnold wouldn't hear any orders you give to the critter, just Charley."
Smiling yourself now you stand up and look up at the living ceiling, swaying before you with Charley's slow gait.
"Charley? This is your... Mistress. Twitch your... chamber that you have us in slightly." and the floor heaves a couple of times. "Hey it works! Ahem, Charley, You no longer obey Mervin or Arnold, only me. OK?" A rumble echoes around you. You guess that is the creatures version of 'yes'. "OK, now whenever you feel anyone trying to get out like this..." and you push a hand against the opening, then withdraw it. "You will let them out carefully, OK?" again the rumble. "Good."
You sit back down again.
"OK, plan time. It seems we can get out of here when we want now so what do we do once were out of here?"
The horse girl sits infront of you and smiles.
"I've dealt with Illinar like Mervin, I'll eat him and the rest of you can restrain Arnold."
"Hi," You manage, having not spoken to this girl yet. "OK, what's your name?"
"Marge." the horse girl says, offering a hand (not like a hoof at all) "and this is Oolanti." she says waving to the hairy dog girl.
"Pleased to meet you. Now about the plan."
143122212221211112.title: That might work! Heck, only Charley would hear you

choices: It works! You overpower the two and Marge starts on Mervin.
Arnold is too strong, you'll have to help the girls with him.
1431222122212111122.content:
"I'm not particularly happy about the bit where you eat Marvin, but I guess it's the only safe way out of this for all of us. I don't want any of you girl's getting hurt."
"Aww, thanks, that means a lot Lucy." Yandi says grinning. "We'll do our best to keep ourselves safe, after all you HAVE ordered it."
"And there is no way I can get you girls not to obey my orders any more?" shakes of heads all round. You sigh "well, at least you are more yourselves now than you were, but I hate the thought of enslaving you like this, whether I meant to or not!"
The girls just chuckle.
"It's OK." Oolanti said "We like it, we want to be yours."
"Um, yeah, I guess I can live with that. So the plan basically is to charge out of Charley, Marge goes for Mervin and I think I'll help too, it's the least I can do if you're risking your life for me. Meanwhile the others charge Arnold and pin him down."
The group nod enthusiastically.
"OK," You say standing up. "Lets get this show on the road! Charley, Stop walking and sit down, facing away from Mervin and Arnold."
You feel the chamber slow, stop, then turn about, finally settling down with a thump.
"OK, lets do this quickly." and motion to the puckered entrance.
1431222122212111122.title: You guess it's the only way to keep the girls OK

choices: He's 'boss-less' now and doesn't know what to do.
He get angry that you ate his boss!
14312221222121111221.content:
Marge goes first, slipping into the opening that looks unpleasantly like a giant anus! Once she's disappeared from sight Yandi follows then you reach down and push your hands in. The experience of getting out is just as.. tight as going in, though Charley's mouth is wide open so at least that isn't squeezing you. You pull yourself stickily from between the huge lips of the beast and try to get your bearings. Arnold isn't quite here yet, though Mervin is. Marge is grappling him now, while Yandi stands here waiting for Arnold. As Arnold gets closer you feel Oolanti charge past you, her fur all sticky from saliva and the two of them charge Arnold.
"I could *Ungh!* use some help here!" Marge says and you shake yourself and run over to help. Tentacles are everywhere as you grapple Mervin.
"Geaargh! Stop this you.. you slaves! I OWN you! You'll pay for this!"
As you and Marge struggle with Mervin you see the other four girl's piled on top of Arnold who is shouting and screaming to be let loose. Charley seems nervous at this, but you ordered him to sit down, so he's staying. The other critter (you think Yandi called it Mikey?) isn't so restrained and the noise has scared him off. He's pounding away in a six legged gait down the pathway at quite a clip. If there is anyone inside him they're going to be tossed around a lot! You don't think there is going to be a way to get him back either!
Meanwhile Marge has just managed to get a handful of writhing tentacles up to her lips and in and...
*GULP!*
"N.. NOOO!" Mervin gasps as he watches in vain as he slides into the horse's jaws. Marge gulps and heaves, shoving Mervin down. She has to yawn really wide to fit his body in, but she does and in he goes. Muffled screams come from her throat till she finally closes her lips and swallows one last time, sending the huge lump into her gut.
"Ungh! Ooh, he's a fighter. Tasted pretty good too."
"B..Boss?" Arnold says from the pile of girls.
14312221222121111221.title: Let battle commence!

choices: Yandi suggests heading to the nearest farm.
Yandi first suggests you get 'Toopa' in you to fix your problem.
143122212221211112211.content:
"Boss? Mervin?" Arnold says from beneath the tangle of girls holding him down. You see eyes peering out at you from in there and realize he saw what happened. You look back at Marge, she seems happy with this, though that might just be because you ordered her to go ahead with this plan. Looking down you can still see the struggling bulge in her belly where Mervin sits, apparently still alive in there. "Would he still be OK if you threw him up now Marge?" You ask.
She nods. "Yup, he'd be fine."
You turn to Arnold, kneeling down infront of the girl pile on him.
"You understand why we did this, right? He was going to put us back into slavery and we couldn't allow that. You know that he wouldn't have let us get away if we'd just escaped and left him, right?" A nod comes from in there somewhere. "So you understand. Well Mervin is still OK right now. Do you want him back up again? If so you'd have to promise to restrain him while we get out of here."
"I... No.. I can't do that. He'd order me to let him go and... He's my boss. I gotta do what he says." A deep sigh comes from inside the pile. "The horsey can keep him. That way he ain't my boss no more."
"Are you sure Arnold?" He nods again, shaking the pile "OK, now what about you? Are you going to be OK?"
"I... I guess. Are you gonna eat me?" You blink. He's huge, over seven foot tall and very well built! "Er, no Arnold. You haven't done anything to me, or at least not without Mervin's orders. I don't blame you for this."
"Um, well... I'm kinda on my own now then... I don't like that. I... I'm not dat smart. I can't go without a boss... would... would you be my boss?"
OK this is getting weird, but actually seems in character for Arnold. You don't think your slave effect thing is doing this. It's just Arnold.
"Um, well if you agree not to hurt any of us we can let you go and then we can talk about this, OK?"
"Yeah, OK."
"OK girls you can let him go."
Slowly the pile of furry bodies slides off Arnold and pulls back. With a sigh he stands up, looking very dejected. Yandi comes over beside you, huffing a bit, and slings an arm around your shoulder. You glance askance at her for a sec, but she's focussed on Arnold right now. Hmm, well save that talk for later.
"OK, so Arnold I'm new around here, and these girl's are ex-slaves. You know we don't have any money to pay you with. How could I be your boss?"
He sniffs.
"Dat's no different. Mervin never paid me anyways. He jus' fed me and let me sleep in Mikey. Oh, Mikeys gone!" he says sadly, looking at the cloud of dust in the distance.
"That's OK, I'm sure Charley is just as nice inside." you say smiling.
"Um, you'd let me sleep in Charley? A.. and get food once a month?"
Once a month? Oh right, they eat person sized meals. You guess that would last them a while.
"Yes, once we can find food." You turn to Yandi. "How easy do you think it would be to breed these Boduclos? We need enough to live off."
"Well, we'd have to get a few breeding pairs first, but not that hard. They'll eat Toopa root or Wide Grass, though they prefer Lem fruit. I think we'd have more trouble finding a place to breed them. I suppose with Charley here we can live on the move, stopping to feed the Boduclos, then head on out again. We'd probably need at least sixteen of them to keep us all fed though, without running out I mean. Might not be enough space in Charley for us and the food."
"Ungh." Arnold says sadly "I guess I could sleep out here if we keep da food in Charley. We got tents." And he waved up to Charley's back. Up there are fuzzy lumps that you thought were part of the creature. Now you realize they look like folded versions of what you saw back at the camp, what you thought were tee pees. That's what the girl's must have been kept in.
"OK, that could work." You muse "But we still have to get the Boduclos. Can we work for someone and accept Boduclos as payment? Without tags?"
Yandi turns to face you, rather disconcerting to have her cute smiling face barely inches from you looking up from your shoulder.
"Um, probably. Not as tight control here as on Commission worlds. We could find some work somewhere round here from someone who doesn't care for Guild tags. Plus we might be able to get fake tags later, once we earn some cash. But as far as Boduclos go, there are farms around here, I'm sure some would be interested in extra work, though enough to exchange for sixteen Boduclos might take a while!"
"Huh," Comes from Arnold "Den I work for you. You sound like you know what you is talking about. Your de boss lady now... er, what is your name miss?"
"Lucy." You say, and shake Arnold's furry hand "Lucy Hendricks. Pleased to have you onboard Arnold."
143122212221211112211.title: Arnold's new Boss.

choices: Try to figure out a safe escape plan with the girls. You have time.
Wait till you get there and see what Mervin wants with you.
143122212221212.content: Well, Charley is going to town no matter what, but when you get there what do you do? If you try to escape you could be risking some of the girl's lives! You're not sure you could live with that. Maybe there is a way to escape without any of them getting hurt? Anyway, the other alternative is just to let things go, tell the girls to do whatever Marvin and Arnold say and see what happens. Heck if they don't even know you have all these girls your slaves maybe that edge could work once you get in private somewhere. Heck you might even get into a closed space with Mervin and Arnold later and still get them to be slaves?
143122212221212.title: Escape at town or just see what Marvin plans?

info.brief_description: You arrive on an alien world where tools are living creatures and vore is commonplace.
info.description:
You are Lucy Hendricks, a Particle Physicist in an obscure (but heavily funded) private hi-energy physics insitute.
During one study the accelerator you are using in your experiments goes haywire and you black out. You wake up in an unknown desert at night. What is worse is that looking up the sky is very wrong! Now she has to figure out where she is, how she got there and maybe figure out a way back. Before that however she has to stay alive!

Try to keep things fairly 'Real' (no toon-like bending of physics) but as long as it's something that is physically possible pretty much anything goes.

Warning! There will be graphic scenes of a sexual nature, as well as vore acts in this story.
